title: If you are playing on a primarily english speaking server
body: in a game with primarily English speaking people, it's probably a good idea to speak english.

replies.body: _This thread has been archived. Commenting and voting have been disabled._
If you don't speak the language don't speak. Just no. All words are fun, consider learning another language before just isolating yourself from the world.
whats the point of this thread? only people who can understand english would be able to read this. if you're going to circlejerk, keep it on gameplay sub.
You aren't even allowed to say things like that these days. I agree with you 100% though.

If this is a different game, say it's mmorpg and we're doing a serious raid where communication isn't optional, I would entirely agree. Not able to find ppl who speak the same language as you to make an alliance with, or not having a server in the language you speak of isn't an excuse to go to a different server and screw up tens of people who paid tremendous efforts beforehand just to ensure they're prepared to make the run a success.

However, this is league, a moba game. It's a team game so it's in a bit of a grey area. While you are encouraged and should communicate with your team, it's not impossible to find success without it, and as things stand - with the community we have - communication sometimes makes things worse. Therefore I can't say for certain.
Or start learning a new language. It actually is transferable to life outside of league, you know, the life that matters.
Non english speaking people have just as much of a right to play as you do.
